Vincent Bagilet

              Vincent Bagilet
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                         Email
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                         GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            Hi and welcome to my personal website!
            I am a third year PhD student in Sustainable Development at Columbia University.
            In my research, I leverage empirical data to study how social norms and peer behavior affect environmental attitudes of individuals. I am also particularly enthusiastic about empirical analyses of environment related issues in general and R programming.
            Prior to joining Columbia, I earned masters in Quantitative Economics from the Paris School of Economics, in Environmental Economics from University Paris Saclay/AgroParisTech and in Engineering with a specialization in energy from Centrale Lyon.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
Work in progress
Inference design in studies on short term health effect of air pollution, with Léo Zabrocki. Last version of the working paper
A trade-off between omitted variable bias and type M error, with Léo Zabrocki.
Published papers
I am still too much of a newbie for that…
